text: The beastmaster ensures all monsters kept aboard are looked after, in turn ensuring his crews make it through the voyage intact.
The engineer oversees all maintenance and repair work undertaken to keep the fleet afloat and in good fighting condition.
The warrant admiral is ultimately responsible for many of the roles that keep the fleet running day-to-day.
The enforcement admiral is the overall fleet admiral's right-hand, making them second-in-command of the whole damned shooting match.
This grand admiral commands the entire fleet of ships, making the death-and-death decisions that effect the entire enterprise.
Dirty guns either don't fire or blow up their gun crews. The gunnery master makes sure no aspect of cannon maintenance is missed.
When everyone aboard's a thief, it's essential to keep good records. The treasurer ensures each ship's log is maintained correctly.
The secretary ensures quartermasters have everything they need to keep their vessels on course and on time.
The sailing admiral is responsible for all matters concerning navigation.
If Orion is occupied elsewhere, a Glade Lord can serve as the queen's champion in his stead.
When it comes to the magical defences of the forest, nothing is taboo.
The Briarmaven’s fanatical devotion to the Ancient Coeddil validates her place at the helm of the mighty Wargrove.
Harmony and balance are the tenets of the forest, and the tenets upon which true magic is wielded by the worthy.
The art of treesinging is divinely facilitated by Isha herself, a gift endowed upon the chosen few.
When the God of the Hunt is roused, the hearts of the forest’s beasts are filled with unrestrained joy.
The magical trickery of the Shadow Dancer is a gift that weaves powerful deceptions.
To carry out the Mage-Queen’s will is to serve the worldly incarnation of Isha herself.
With guidance, the embittered Dryads’ rage and malice can give them great strength and resilience.
The voices of those who have fallen victim to the Elves’ folly shall never be forgotten.
The Asrai are not always the enemy, for they are merely misguided souls in need of a Tree Spirit’s authority.
Steadfast it may be, but the alliance between flora and fauna still requires a strong and worthy exponent.
A broken branch is regrown anew, as leaves refresh each year. Such is Delliandra.
Druthandor’s Ancient speaks with a knowledge that belies centuries of learning.
What magics are weaved by Talrennic! Mysteries to keep interlopers confounded…
The Ancient speaks in portents; as Threllock goes, so goes Athel Loren.
The one who fires the sacred first shot delivers the final entreaty to the Hunter-God for his blessings.
Orion is the Master of the Hunt and Ariel’s chosen consort. In the forest, his word is law.
Eldest of all the Treemen, Durthu dispenses uncontained rage and melancholic wisdom.
What duty is more sacred than the Hunt? It is every Asrai’s duty to follow the trail.
The Horn of the Wild Hunt calls even the trees, guiding them to the quarry with its clarion call.
The hunt must be well-equipped with all the panoply of war.
The booming pulse of the hunting drums drives forth both hunter and prey.
By the wiles of the most swift and resourceful, the lay of the land will be reconnoitered.
Elected sovereign, Protector of the Empire, Defiler of the Dark and wielder of Skull Splitter.
